snippet: Prosecutors have asked a judge to try Officer William Porter first in the case because they say he will be called as a witness to testify against others.
abstract: Prosecutors involved in Baltimore trial on police shooting of Freddie Gray ask Judge Barry Williams to try Officer William Porter first, as he will be called as witness in trials of at least two of the five other officers facing charges.
lead_paragraph: Prosecutors have asked a judge to try Officer William Porter first in the case because they say he will be called as a witness to testify against others.

headline.main: Maryland: Officer Singled Out for First Trial in Freddie Gray Case
headline.print_headline: Maryland: Officer Singled Out for First Trial in Freddie Gray Case
